isis.stitle: CF 500, CF 600 Entertainment System - Entertainment System - General Information - Diagnosis and Testing

svcprocinfo.para: Refer to Wiring Diagrams for schematic and connector information.

svcsubproc.title: Principles of Operation
svcsubproc.para: The audio unit can be powered up when the ignition is in the ON or ACC position. The audio unit provides audio signals to the speakers to produce sound.
The antenna receives AM and FM radio waves. The AM and FM waves are sent to the audio unit through the antenna cables.

step1.para: Visually inspect for obvious signs of mechanical or electrical damage.

item.para: Audio unit damaged, misaligned or controls inoperative
Antenna or antenna cable physically damaged or misaligned

entry.para: The audio unit is inoperative/does not operate correctly
Poor quality/distorted sound/no sound from one or more speakers (not all speakers)
Poor quality/distorted sound/no sound from all speakers
One or more audio control buttons are not functional in either audio, tape or CD mode
INSTALL a new audio unit. REFER to Audio Unit. TEST the system for normal operation.

svcsubproc.title: Pinpoint Tests

para.emph: Pinpoint Test A: The Audio Unit Is Inoperative/Does Not Operate Correctly

svcsubproc.para: The audio unit receives power from the power distribution center circuit 137 (YE/BK) and ground through circuit 57 (BK). The audio unit receives voltage at all times from circuit 1772 (VT) for memory.

table.title: PINPOINT TEST A: THE AUDIO UNIT IS INOPERATIVE/DOES NOT OPERATE CORRECTLY

para.emph: A1 CHECK THE OPERATION OF THE AUDIO UNIT
Is the audio unit display illuminated?
A2 CHECK FOR SOUND COMING FROM THE SPEAKERS

item.para: Adjust the speaker controls left to right.
Check for sound from the speakers.

para.emph: Is sound coming from the speakers?
A3 CARRY OUT THE CONTROLS AND FEATURES TEST

item.para: Verify that all the audio system controls and features operate correctly. Refer to the owner's literature.

para.emph: Do all the controls and features operate correctly?

entry.para: INFORM the customer how to correctly operate the audio system controls and features.
INSTALL a new audio unit. REFER to Audio Unit. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: A4 CHECK CIRCUITS 137 (YE/BK) AND 1772 (VT) FOR VOLTAGE

item.para: Disconnect: Audio Unit C240 or C290 (If equipped with premium radio)
If equipped with base radio, measure the voltage between audio unit C240-4 circuit 137 (YE/BK), harness side and ground; and between audio unit C240-7 circuit 1772 (VT), harness side and ground.
If equipped with premium radio, measure the voltage between audio unit C290-B circuit 137 (YE/BK), harness side and ground; and between audio unit C290-O circuit 1772 (VT), harness side and ground.

para.emph: Are the voltages greater than 10 volts?

entry.para: VERIFY the power distribution center (PDC) fuse 27 (10A) or fuse 42 (10A) is OK. If OK, REPAIR the circuit in question. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: A5 CHECK CIRCUIT 57 (BK) FOR AN OPEN

item.para: If equipped with base radio, measure the resistance between audio unit C240-8 circuit 57 (BK), harness side and ground.
If equipped with premium radio, measure the resistance between audio unit C290-C circuit 57 (BK), harness side and ground.

para.emph: Is the resistance less than 5 ohms?

entry.para: REPAIR the circuit. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: A6 CHECK FOR CORRECT AUDIO UNIT OPERATION

item.para: Disconnect all the audio unit connectors.
Connect the audio unit connectors and make sure they seat correctly.
Operate the system and determine if the concern is still present.

entry.para: INSTALL a new audio unit. REFER to Audio Unit. TEST the system for normal operation.
The system is operating correctly at this time. The concern may have been caused by a loose or corroded connector.

svcsubproc.para: The antenna receives AM and FM signals. The AM and FM signals are sent to the audio unit through the antenna cables.

para.emph: B1 CHECK THE ANTENNA CABLE CONNECTIONS
Are the connections clean, secure and in metal-to-metal contact?

entry.para: CLEAN or SECURE the antenna cable connections as necessary. TEST the system for normal operation.

item.para: Check the ignition circuits for correct routing, grounding and security of connections.

entry.para: REPAIR the circuits as necessary. TEST the system for normal operation.

item.para: Test the ignition system. Refer to the Powertrain Control/Emissions Diagnosis manual.

entry.para: REPAIR the ignition system as necessary. REFER to the Engine Operation and Maintenance Manual. TEST the system for normal operation.

item.para: Substitute a known good antenna cable. Refer to Antenna.
Verify the operation of the audio unit.

entry.para: REPAIR or INSTALL a new antenna cable. REFER to Antenna. TEST the system for normal operation.
REINSTALL the original antenna cable. REFER to Antenna. GO to B5.

item.para: Substitute a known good audio unit. Refer to Audio Unit .
Verify the operation of the audio unit.

entry.para: REPAIR or INSTALL a new audio unit. REFER to Audio Unit. TEST the system for normal operation.

INSTALL the original audio unit. USE a jumper cable to ground various parts of the vehicle to the frame (for example, the engine, fenders, quarter panels, stone deflectors, engine air cleaner or body sheet metal). When the noise is eliminated, PROVIDE a permanent ground where necessary. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: Pinpoint Test C: Poor Quality/Distorted Sound/No Sound From One Or More Speakers (Not All Speakers)

svcsubproc.para: The audio unit directs the audio signals to the speakers through separate positive and negative circuits for each of the audio channels LF and RF.

item.para: High resistance or short to ground in speaker circuits

table.title: PINPOINT TEST C: POOR QUALITY/DISTORTED SOUND/NO SOUND FROM ONE OR MORE SPEAKERS (NOT ALL SPEAKERS)

para.emph: C1 CHECK FOR POOR QUALITY SOUND/NO SOUND FROM THE SPEAKERS

item.para: Adjust the speaker controls left to right.

para.emph: Do all speakers have poor quality/no sound?

entry.para: IF poor quality/distorted sound/no sound from all speakers, GO to Pinpoint Test D.

para.emph: C2 CHECK SIGNAL TO SUSPECT SPEAKER

item.para: Disconnect: Suspect Speaker C523 (LF) or C612 (RF)
Measure the A/C voltage between connector pins of suspect speaker, harness side as follows:

entry.para: Suspect Speaker LH Front: Connector-Pin C523-2 - Circuit 804 (OG/LG)
Suspect Speaker LH Front: Connector-Pin C523-1 - Circuit 287 (BK/WH)
Suspect Speaker RH Front: Connector-Pin C612-2 - Circuit 805 (WH/LG)
Suspect Speaker RH Front: Connector-Pin C612-1 - Circuit 287 (BK/WH)

para.emph: Is there fluctuating A/C voltage present?

item.para: Verify operation of the audio unit.

entry.para: INSTALL a new speaker. REFER to Speakers. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: C4 CHECK FOR CORRECT AUDIO UNIT OPERATION

item.para: Disconnect all the audio unit connectors.
Connect the audio unit connectors and make sure they seat correctly.
Operate the system and determine if concern is still present.

entry.para: INSTALL a new audio unit. REFER to Audio Unit. TEST the system for normal operation.
The system is operating correctly at this time. The concern may have been caused by a loose or corroded connector.

para.emph: C5 CHECK CIRCUITS 804 (OG/LG), 287 (BK/WH) AND 805 (WH/LG) FOR AN OPEN OR A SHORT TO GROUND

item.para: Disconnect: Audio Unit C240 (Base radio) or C290 (Premium radio)
Measure the resistance between audio unit C240 or C290, harness side and suspect speaker, harness side; and between audio unit C240 or C290, harness side and ground as follows:

para.emph: Are the resistances less than 5 ohms between the audio unit and the suspect speaker, and greater than 10,000 ohms between the audio unit and ground?

entry.para: INSTALL a new speaker. REFER to Speakers. TEST the system for normal operation.
REPAIR the circuit(s) in question. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: Pinpoint Test D: Poor Quality/Distorted Sound/No Sound From All Speakers

svcsubproc.para: The audio unit directs the audio signals to speakers through separate positive and negative circuits.

para.emph: D1 CHECK FOR CORRECT AUDIO UNIT OPERATION
Does the audio unit display illuminate?
